intro: Soehrensia bruchii var. roseiflora, commonly known as the rose-flowered hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, rose-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink and red. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with palmately lobed leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna or woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
